metadata.title: CVE-2022-42928 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Certain types of allocations were missing annotations that, if the GarbageCollector was in a specific state, could have lead to memory corruption anda potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 106,Firefox ESR < 102.4, and Thunderbird < 102.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
